description: Extension and refurbishment of the existing garage for use as garden room and alterations to the existing garden.
decision_conditions:
The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.295;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;">Detailed drawings, full particulars and/or samples of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before the commencement of the relevant part of works. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved which shall be implemented in full prior to the first use of the development.<br></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.295;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;">i) Details of the proposed windows, doors and shutter, in the form of 1:20 horizontal and vertical section drawings</p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.295;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;">ii)&nbsp; All facing materials to be used on the external surfaces of the building, including brick sample.</p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.295;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:8pt;">REASON: To ensure that the special architectural and historic interest of this building is safeguarded and that the proposal does not detract from the character and appearance of the surrounding area.&nbsp;</p>

<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;">No development shall commence, other than works of demolition, until a detailed specification and a drainage layout of at least one suitable sustainable drainage systems (i.e. water butt, raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving etc.) has been submitted to, and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the SuDS&nbsp; officer. If soakaways i.e. plastic modules and soakaway rings are used, an infiltration test must be carried out to ensure that the capacity of the soil is suitable for infiltration. It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume for all return periods up to the 1 in 100 year storm events plus an allowance for climate change.<br></p><p><br></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline;">REASON: In the interests of prevention of exacerbation of surface water flood risk to adjoining land.</span></p>
